content.question: Which of the following is the solution to the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, open parenthesis, x minus 2, close parenthesis, times, open parenthesis, y minus 2, close parenthesis " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="y greater than 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>></mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> with the initial condition <math alttext="y of 4, equals 5 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals, 4 plus e raised to the, open parenthesis, the fraction x squared over 2, end fraction, minus 2 x, close parenthesis, power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, 2 plus 3 times e raised to the, open parenthesis, the fraction x squared over 2, end fraction, minus 2 x, close parenthesis, power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the fraction with numerator 4 plus the square root of, 16 plus 4 times, open parenthesis, x squared, minus 4 x, plus 5, close parenthesis, end root, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>16</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="y equals, the complex fraction with numerator negative x squared, plus 4 x, plus 5, and denominator, open parenthesis, 1 minus the fraction x squared over 2, end fraction, plus 2 x, close parenthesis, end complex fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals, 2 plus 3 times e raised to the, open parenthesis, the fraction x squared over 2, end fraction, minus 2 x, close parenthesis, power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.7: Finding Particular Solutions Using Initial Conditions and Separation of Variables

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
